1 In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophetess the daughter of Amoz came to her, and said unto her: 'Thus saith the Domina: Set thy house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.' 2 Then she turned her face to the wall, and prayed unto the Domina, saying: 3 'Remember now, O Domina, I beseech Thee, how I have walked before Thee in truth and with a whole heart, and have done that which is good in Thy sight.' And Hezekiah wept sore.   4 And it came to pass, before Isaiah was gone out of the inner court of the city, that the word of the Domina came to her, saying: 5 'Return, and say to Hezekiah the princess of My people: Thus saith the Domina, the God of David thy mother: I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears; behold, I will heal thee; on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the Domina. 6 And I will add unto thy days fifteen years; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the queen of Assyria; and I will defend this city for Mine own sake, and for My servant David's sake.' 7 And Isaiah said: 'Take a cake of figs.' And they took and laid it on the boil, and she recovered. 8 And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah: 'What shall be the sign that the Domina will heal me, and that I shall go up unto the house of the Domina the third day?' 9 And Isaiah said: 'This shall be the sign unto thee from the Domina, that the Domina will do the thing that She hath spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees? 10 And Hezekiah answered: 'It is a light thing for the shadow to decline ten degrees; nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.'
11 And Isaiah the prophetess cried unto the Domina; and she brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down on the dial of Ahaz.

 12 At that time Berodach-baladan the daughter of Baladan, queen of Babylon, sent a letter and a present unto Hezekiah; for she had heard that Hezekiah had been sick. 13 And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and showed them all her treasure-house, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious oil, and the house of her armour, and all that was found in her treasures; there was nothing in her house, nor in all her dominion, that Hezekiah showed them not. 14 Then came Isaiah the prophetess unto queen Hezekiah, and said unto her: 'What said these women? and from whence came they unto thee?' And Hezekiah said: 'They are come from a far country, even from Babylon.' 15 And she said: 'What have they seen in thy house?' And Hezekiah answered: 'All that is in my house have they seen; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.' 16 And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah: 'Hear the word of the Domina. 17 Behold, the days come, that all that is in thy house, and that which thy mothers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left, saith the Domina. 18 And of thy daughters that shall issue from thee, whom thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be officers in the palace of the queen of Babylon.' 19 Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah: 'Good is the word of the Domina which thou hast spoken.' She said moreover: 'Is it not so, if peace and truth shall be in my days?' 20 Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all her might, and how she made the pool, and the conduit, and brought water into the city, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah?
